intro: Chrysanthemum inodorum, commonly known as the scentless chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with radiating petals. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and produces yellow to white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Chrysanthemum inodorum is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive blooms and hardy nature.
